questions.uddipok:
Mark Zuckerberg is co-founder and CEO of the social networking website Facebook, as well as one of the world's youngest billionaires. Mark Elliot Zuckerberg was born on May 14, 1984, in White Plains, New York, into a comfortable, well-educated family, and raised in the nearby village of Dobbs Ferry. His father, Edward Zuckerberg, ran a dental practice attached to the family's home. His mother, Karen, worked as a psychiatrist before the birth of the couple's four children Mark, Pandi, Donna and Arielle. Zuckerberg developed an interest in computers at an early age. When he was about 12, he used Atari BASIC to create a messaging programme he named "Zucknet'. His father used the programme in his dental office. Zuckerberg later studied at Phillips Exeter Academy, an exclusive preparatory school in New Hampshire. There he showed talent in fencing, becoming the captain of the school's team. He also excelled in literature, earning a diploma in classics. Yet Zuckerberg remained fascinated by computers, and continued to work on developing new programmes. While still in high school, he created an early version of the music software Pandora, which he called Synapse. Several companies - including AOL and Microsoft- expressed an interest in buying the software, and hiring the teenager before graduation. He declined the offers.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Mark Zuckerberg, born in 1984 in New York, is the co-founder of Facebook and one of the youngest billionaires. Interested in computers from a young age, he created "Zucknet" at about 12. He developed early software like "Synapse" while studying in high school. Despite offers from AOL and Microsoft, he continued his education; showcasing talent in both academics and technology.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Tree Plantation'. You should write it in about 200 words.
(a) What is tree plantation? (b) Why should we plant trees? (c) When and where can we plant trees? (d) How can we take care of trees? (e) What should the government do in this regard?

sub_questions.explanation:
Tree Plantation
Tree plantation means planting trees on a large scale in a planned way. Trees are our friends. They give us shade and soothe our eyes with their green colour. They give us various kinds of fruits. They give us firewood as fuel for cooking. They give us timber for furniture, doors and windows, boats, electric poles, railway slippers, etc. They give us rubber too. Trees take in carbon dioxide and produce oxygen. Sufficient trees cause sufficient rainfall and prevent draught. Trees along the roadside and coastal areas preyent erosion and tidal bore. But many inconsiderate pcople are cutting down trees for their selfish interests. So, we are losing trees. If there is no tree, there will be no civilization. In fact, the loss of trees will take our existence to the verge of extinction. The earth will be no more habitable. Hence, tree plantation must be taken as a project. The more we plant trees, the morė our environment will be balanced and greener. In Bangladesh, tree plantation is compulsory because we do not have as much forest as we require to maintain the ecological balance. There is no specific time to plant trees. We can plant trees any time of the year based on the type of the trees. Park, yard, urban areas, open field, balcony, rooftops; roadside places, etc. are best places to plant trees. To make life peaceful, there is no alternative to tree plantation.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Write at least ten new sentences to complete the story and give a title to it.
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But……………

sub_questions.explanation:
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But he found that there was no water in the house.

Without any hesitation, Bayazid took the water pot and went out in search of water. It was a dark and cold night, and everyone was asleep. He walked a long distance to the nearest well. After collecting the water, he hurried back home. But when he reached home, he saw that his mother had fallen asleep again.

Bayazid did not want to wake her up. So, he stood beside her bed with the glass of water in his hand. He remained standing the whole night, waiting patiently for his mother to wake up. When his mother opened her eyes in the morning, she was surprised to see Bayazid standing with the glass of water. Tears came to her eyes, and she hugged her son with love.

Bayazid’s deep love and respect for his mother made him a great man later in life. His story continues to inspire children to honor and care for their pa
rents.

sub_questions.explanation:
To: mithun99@gmail.com
Subject: Positive and negative aspects of Facebook Dear Mithun,
I hope this letter finds you well. I want to share some thoughts on Facebook, a platform that has become an integral part of our daily lives. Facebook offers numerous advantages. It provides connectivity that allows us to keep in touch with friends and family worldwide. It provides a hub for news and updates to keep us informed. It also facilitates professional networking, which can lead to job opportunities, and serves as a powerful marketing tool for businesspersons to reach a large audięnce. Additionally, Facebook offers entertainment options from videos, reels'and games. However, there are notable disadvantages, including privacy concerns where personal information can be exposed or misused, and the risk of addiction that affects productivity and mental health. questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Shreyan. You have a foreign friend named John. He wants to know about the recent flood of our country. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the recent flood and its effect on general people.

sub_questions.explanation:
Shreyan : Hey John, did you see the news about the recent floods?
John : Yeah, Shreyan. The situation is really devastating. So many people have lost their homes and belongings.
Shreyan : I know, Entire villages are submerged. People are struggling to find shelter and food.
John : The government and NGOs are trying to help, but the scale of the disaster is overwhelming.
Shreyan : Absolutely. The floods have destroyed crops too. This will lead to food shortages and increased prices.
John : Diseases can spread easily in such conditions due to contaminated water.
Shreyan : Yes, health is a major concern. Hospitals are already crowded, and now they have to deal with this additional burden.
John : The economic impact is huge as well. Business sectors are affected, and many people have lost their jobs.
Shreyan : It's heart-breaking to see the huge numbers of people suffering. We need more support for these communities to rebuild their lives.
John : : : True. We can help by donating to relief funds and raising awareness about the situation.
Shreyan : Let's hope for the best. I have to go now. See you later.
John : Okay, bye.
